programme.title: Offsiders Ep48
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Corbin Middlemas and a panel of sportswriters, commentators, coaches, athletes and officials cover the week's sporting action plus a look back at the key issues, events and moments of the year. (Final for 2023)

programme.title: ABC News Ep99
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Miriam Corowa presents the latest from ABC News, following today's top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, expert analysis and all the updated news, sport, weather and information you need.

programme.title: Project Wild - Cambodia Ep1
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Nature nerd Dr Ann Jones travels through the Indo-Pacific region to find the dedicated people bringing our planet's amazing animals, plants and ecosystems back from the brink. This time she visits biodiversity-rich Cambodia.

programme.title: Gardening Australia - Indonesia Special Ep36
programme.desc: Sr. 34 - Costa and Tammy explore the plants and gardens of Indonesia, one of Australia's nearest neighbours. This incredible island nation is one of the most biodiverse places on earth, filled with unique species found nowhere else.

programme.title: The Pacific - Summer Special Ep17
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - A look back at some of our favourite stories from the region. In PNG Betel nut traders risk their lives to make an income, Tahiti's ancient art of Tatau, and we hear from renowned Solomon Islands musician Charles Maimarosia.

programme.title: Landline: Asia Pacific Special - Fiji Ep2
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - In Fiji, Landline reports on the growth in beekeeping and the management of varroa mite, plus the surge in kava farming and new products for the export market.

programme.title: 7.30 Interview with Cheng Lei
programme.desc: In this extended interview with 7.30's Sarah Ferguson, Australian journalist Cheng Lei describes the conditions and mental anguish of her incarceration in China.

programme.title: Planet America: Fireside Chat Ep18
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Unwind by the fire with Chas and John as they unpack the week's news, politics and events in the USA. With two wars, economic headwinds, uncertainty and tension on many fronts it is a stressful time for many Americans.

programme.title: Built To Survive - Island Castaways Ep7
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Phil Breslin leaves the Australian mainland for some island-hopping fun and encounters a green sea turtle laying her eggs, a pack of wild dingoes on the hunt and a snake with a terrifying name - death adder, lying in ambush.

programme.title: Decoding Danger - Predators Ep1
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Australia is home to some of the deadliest predators in the world. The island continent is notorious for playing host to the most venomous snakes, the most deadly crocodiles, spiders and jellyfish.

programme.title: Dolphins: Is Our Love Too Deep?
programme.desc: A ground-breaking investigative documentary that explores the impact humans are having on wild dolphins through hand feeding tourism programs at Monkey Mia and Bunbury in WA, and Moreton Bay and Tin Can Bay in Queensland.

programme.title: Project Wild - Cambodia Ep1
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Nature nerd Dr Ann Jones travels through the Indo-Pacific region to find the dedicated people bringing our planet's amazing animals, plants and ecosystems back from the brink. This time she visits biodiversity-rich Cambodia.

programme.title: 7.30 Interview with Cheng Lei
programme.desc: In this extended interview with 7.30's Sarah Ferguson, Australian journalist Cheng Lei describes the conditions and mental anguish of her incarceration in China.

programme.title: Art Works - Underwater Sculptures, Tee Ken Ng Ep22
programme.desc: Sr. 3 - This week, we go diving on the Great Barrier Reef with underwater sculptor Jason deCaires Taylor; enjoy a classical concert by candlelight; meet artist and award-winning animator Tee Ken Ng; plus slam poet Mel Ree performs.

programme.title: Australian Story Ep33
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Leigh Sales introduces the award-winning program with no narrator and no agendas. Immerse yourself in the life of an extraordinary Australian and their authentic stories, told in their own words. (Final for 2023)

programme.title: ABC News Overnight Ep99
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - The final word on the day's top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australia's most trusted source of independent news.

programme.title: Landline: Asia Pacific Special - Fiji Ep2
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - In Fiji, Landline reports on the growth in beekeeping and the management of varroa mite, plus the surge in kava farming and new products for the export market.

programme.title: The Pacific - Summer Special Ep18
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - A look back at some of our favourite stories from the region. We go to Solomon Islands where the legacy of WWII is still being felt. Plus we hear from two Pacific music legends Jean Gabilou and American Idol winner Iam Tongi.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight Ep99
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - The final word on the day's top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australia's most trusted source of independent news.

programme.title: Insiders Ep44
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - At the end of the parliamentary year, David Speers and a panel of leading political commentators and reporters look back on the week and also the year in national affairs and award the Matt Price Moment. (Final for 2023)

programme.title: Offsiders Ep48
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Corbin Middlemas and a panel of sportswriters, commentators, coaches, athletes and officials cover the week's sporting action plus a look back at the key issues, events and moments of the year. (Final for 2023)

programme.title: Australian Story Ep33
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Leigh Sales introduces the award-winning program with no narrator and no agendas. Immerse yourself in the life of an extraordinary Australian and their authentic stories, told in their own words. (Final for 2023)

programme.title: Close Of Business - Year In Review Special Ep45
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Rachel Pupazzoni and the team look back on the year 2023. As the global economy recovers post pandemic we saw cost-of-living and inflation rising, so too interest rates and wages, a tight housing market and low unemployment.

programme.title: The World This Week Ep47
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Beverley O'Connor brings you a weekly roundup of international news from an Australian perspective as reported by ABC News correspondents covering the Indo Pacific, Europe, North America, the Middle East, India and Indonesia.

programme.title: ABC News Regional Ep45
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Take a closer look at what's making headlines in regional and rural Australia. ABC News reporters uncover the news and unique stories about what's really going on outside the big cities. Presented by Amy Culpitt.

programme.title: Breaking the Code: Cyber Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: Australian spies are on the offensive against cyber criminal networks and foreign actors seeking to disrupt democracies. But our intelligence agencies have a long history playing a key role in secret battles.

programme.title: News Breakfast Ep246
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Be the first to know the latest overnight developments, breaking news and the top stories this morning. Lisa Millar and Bridget Brennan bring you news and interviews, joined by Emma Rebellato, Tony Armstrong and Nate Byrne.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings Ep246
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - When big stories break, turn to Karina Carvalho in the mornings to bring you what's happening and why it matters. ABC News has more reporters in more places, serving and connecting communities and telling your stories.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon Ep246
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the day's top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Gardening Australia - Indonesia Special Ep36
programme.desc: Sr. 34 - Costa and Tammy explore the plants and gardens of Indonesia, one of Australia's nearest neighbours. This incredible island nation is one of the most biodiverse places on earth, filled with unique species found nowhere else.

programme.title: The Homes That Built Australia - The Birth of the 'Burbs' (1945 -1960) Ep1
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - The end of WW2 marks the beginning of radical transformations to Australia's housing landscape - social, cultural and architectural history is about to unfold in ways never before seen on this vast continent.

programme.title: Landline: Asia Pacific Special - Fiji Ep2
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - In Fiji, Landline reports on the growth in beekeeping and the management of varroa mite, plus the surge in kava farming and new products for the export market.

programme.title: Project Wild - Tonga Ep2
programme.desc: Sr. 1 - Nature nerd, Dr Ann Jones travels through the Indo-Pacific region to find the dedicated people bringing our planet's amazing animals, plants and ecosystems back from the brink. This time Ann explores the Kingdom of Tonga.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons Ep3
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and the day's stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Joe O'Brien.

programme.title: ABC News with Joe O'Brien Ep246
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Joe O'Brien brings you a comprehensive summary of the day's events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on what's going on.

programme.title: The Drum Ep231
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Whatever the day brings we come together to talk through the issues, share stories and find understanding, support, comfort and a sense of community by listening to the opinions of other people.

programme.title: ABC National News Ep246
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and the day's stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Joe O'Brien.

programme.title: 7.30 Ep193
programme.desc: Sr. 2023 - Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight Ep246

programme.desc: Today: explaining that you can't make a decision on the spot. Astriana Faradillah, from Indonesia, works in sales. In a roleplay challenge, she deals with clients who request an on-the-spot discount.

programme.title: A Cat'S-Eye View Of Japan
programme.desc: Active volcanos bless Kagoshima with natural hot springs. Visit a boss cat near an ashiyu foot bath, help kitties guard a brewery, and relax with a bath house kitty.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN's flagship hourly news program delivers the latest world news, business and weather, with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.

programme.title: Darwin'S Amazing Animals
programme.desc: In the forest-covered mountains a few hours from Tokyo lies a simple puddle with a big secret. It never dries up, and attracts wildlife including green pigeons who gulp down its mysterious waters.

programme.title: Time-Lapse Journey
programme.desc: For over 100 years, Hirosaki Park in Aomori Prefecture has been a beloved spot to see sakura blossoms. See the multifaceted beauty of sakura blossoms through time-lapse photography.

programme.title: Take Tech
programme.desc: A program for upper primary to lower secondary school children to explore the everyday technologies all around them. Each episode takes a piece of familiar tech to find out what it does and how.

programme.title: U&I
programme.desc: This show for kids promotes a greater understanding for people with difficulties and helps develop empathy. With the help of two fairies, the main character thinks about what can be done to help.

programme.title: Japan'S Top Inventions
programme.desc: The fascinating stories and behind hit Japanese products, plus parts and machines that boast the top share of niche markets. This time: stand-up personal watercrafts & rice crackers with peanuts.

programme.title: Bosai: Solar Flares
programme.desc: The sun's tremendous energy provides various benefits, but also poses some significant risks. In this episode, we will explore the mysteries of solar flares, and their threat to human activities.

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Allen vs. Craig EpPrelims
programme.desc: In a wide-open middleweight division, every fight is an important one, and on November 18, 185-pound contenders Brendan Allen and Paul Craig collide in a UFC Fight Night main event at the APEX in Las Vegas that will set up a huge 2024 campaign for the winner. programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Allen vs. Craig EpMainEvent

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Almeida vs. Lewis EpPrelims
programme.desc: On October 21, the UFC returns to Abu Dhabi, where two of the top fighters in the world, pound for pound, will meet again as Islam Makhachev defends his lightweight title against featherweight champion Alexander Volkanovski in the main event of UFC 294 at Etihad Arena. In February, the pair met for the first time, engaging in a Fight of the Year candidate that left fans demanding a rematch. Now Makhachev, who has won 12 straight, will attempt to make it two in a row over the Aussie star, who is hungry to even the score with the 155-pound king. Plus, middleweight sensation Khamzat Chimaev welcomes former welterweight champion Kamaru Usman to the division in a fight with serious title implications at 185 pounds
